## WidgetDiv.show() function

Initialize and display the widget div. Close the old one if needed.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function show(newOwner: unknown, rtl: boolean, newDispose: () => void, workspace?: WorkspaceSvg | null, manageEphemeralFocus?: boolean): void;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

newOwner


</td><td>

unknown


</td><td>

The object that will be using this container.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

rtl


</td><td>

boolean


</td><td>

Right-to-left (true) or left-to-right (false).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

newDispose


</td><td>

() =&gt; void


</td><td>

Optional cleanup function to be run when the widget is closed.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

workspace


</td><td>

[WorkspaceSvg](./blockly.workspacesvg_class.md) \| null


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The workspace associated with the widget owner.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

manageEphemeralFocus


</td><td>

boolean


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Whether ephemeral focus should be managed according to the widget div's lifetime. Note that if a false value is passed in here then callers should manage ephemeral focus directly otherwise focus may not properly restore when the widget closes. Defaults to true.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

void
